授業目的: The sub-title of the course: Canadian Foreign Relations.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業の概要・背景: See below.  We will use only English-language materials (no French-language materials).  This course deals with the most up-to-date information on Canada's foreign affairs. The students are encouraged to follow Canada's credible news sources such as National Newswatch (https://www.nationalnewswatch.com/), the Global and Mail, CBC News, etc. on a daily basis, in order to gain intellectual literacy on Canada.
授業方法: This is mainly a lecture course although the students will engage in class discussion.  In Sessions 1-4, we will go through background information about Canada and its external relations.  In Sessions 5-8, we will review and compare the old and new policy paradigms of Canada’s global approach, followed by an in-class mid-term exam in Session 9.  In Sessions 10-13, we will review and compare the old and new policy paradigms of Canada’s Pacific strategy, followed by an in-class final exam in Session 14.

第1回: The introduction and organization session.  This is the first of the four lecture sessions on background information.  We will study the basic features of Canada as a country.  All the 14 sessions will be face-to-face (in-person) sessions.
The students are to have completed the assigned reading material before coming to class (see the attachment for specific instructions).
第2回: The second background session.  We will review the history of Canada's foreign relations.
第3回: The third background session.  We will review the general theories of international relations (Realism, Liberalism, and Constructivism).
第4回: The fourth background session.  We will examine the argument of "Canada as a principal power" along with other models of Canadian foreign policy.
第5回: Sessions 5-8 deal with the general policy paradigm of Canadian foreign policy, comparing the old version with the new one.  This session deals with the old version.  We will read "Strong, Secure, Engaged" (2017), the Canadian military's policy document.
第6回: This session dissects and analyzes "Strong, Secure, Engaged." The students must engage in discussion.
第7回: This session examines the new policy paradigm, the "Freeland Doctrine" (a recent speech made by Deputy Prime Minister Freeland). We will compare and contrast between the two policy paradigms.  The students must engage in discussion.
第8回: In this session, we will watch a video clip that discusses the "Freeland Doctrine."  After that, we will compare and contrast the old and new policy paradigms. The students must engage in discussion.
第9回: In-class mid-term exam.  More instructions will be provided beforehand.
第10回: Sessions 10-13 cover the old and new policy paradigms of Canada's Pacific foreign policy.  This session examines the old paradigm that focuses on China.
The students are to have completed the assigned reading material before coming to class (see the attachment for specific instructions).
第11回: This session is the first of the two on the new policy paradigm.  We will review "Canada's Indo-Pacific Strategy" (2022).
第12回: In this session, we will dissect and analyze "Canada's Indo-Pacific Strategy" (2022). We will then compare and contrast between the two policy paradigms.  The students must engage in discussion.
第13回: We will watch two short TV clips (interviews) on "Canada's Indo-Pacific Strategy" (2022).  After that, we will continue to compare and contrast the old and new policy paradigms.  The student must engage in discussion.
第14回: In-class final exam.  More instructions will be provided beforehand. This is the final session of the course.
